description:
**Problem**
REALTIME_PLAN ยง13 expects Git lane to use checkpoint import/export for bootstrap and recovery. Current daemon load path still reads only legacy refs/heads/beads/store; checkpoint import code exists but is never invoked. This means checkpoint lane is export-only and cannot be used for bootstrap/catch-up.

Evidence:
- src/daemon/git_worker.rs: load()/load_local() read refs/heads/beads/store via git::sync.
- rg import_checkpoint shows no call sites outside tests.

**Why this violates plan**
Plan requires checkpoint import to drive bootstrap and recovery in v0.5 (snapshot bootstrap is deferred, but checkpoints are not).

**Acceptance**
- [ ] Wire checkpoint import into daemon load path (alongside legacy lane for migration).
- [ ] Ensure imported checkpoints set applied/durable watermarks to included values.
- [ ] Add tests for loading from checkpoint ref.
title: Checkpoint import not wired into daemon load path

acceptance_criteria:
**Acceptance**
- [ ] File logging is enabled by default for `bd daemon run` and disabled under tests.
- [ ] Core realtime spans/metrics include the required context fields.
- [ ] Tests validate logging/tracing configuration and context propagation.
description:
**Problem**
We lack end-to-end observability guarantees for realtime: tracing context is incomplete, and file logging defaults are not validated for daemon runs vs tests. Debugging real tailnet failures remains brittle.
design:
**Design**
- Define a tracer/logger interface (or consistent tracing setup) that always includes critical context: store_id, store_epoch, replica_id, namespace, txn_id, client_request_id, origin_replica_id, origin_seq.
- Enable file logging by default for daemon runs, and disable it during tests (BD_TESTING).
- Add integration tests/assertions that context fields are present for key spans and that file logging is not enabled in tests.
title: Realtime: tracing + file logging defaults

description:
**Problem**
Forward-jump clamping only logs; no structured clock anomaly info is surfaced in status/doctor.

**Design**
Record last clock anomaly in daemon/repo state (timestamp, delta, kind) and expose via status/doctor outputs.

**Acceptance**
- [ ] Forward-jump clamp updates clock anomaly record
- [ ] Status/doctor includes last anomaly fields
- [ ] Tests cover update + serialization
title: Clock anomaly record missing in admin status/doctor (REALTIME_PLAN ยง2.8)

description:
**Problem**
Viewing child issues of an epic requires separate commands. Need inline display of children with parent details.

**Design**
Add `--children` flag to `bd show` that:
- Shows parent issue details first
- Lists all child issues below (issues that depend on parent via parent-child dependency)
- Children displayed in tree format with indentation
- Respects --short flag for compact child display

Reference: `/Users/darin/Projects/beads-rs-macstudio/tmp/beads/cmd/bd/show.go` lines 87-91

Example output:
```
bd-abc123 [P1] [epic] open - User authentication system
  Description: ...
  Children:
    bd-abc123.1 [P1] [feature] in_progress - OAuth integration
    bd-abc123.2 [P2] [feature] open - Session management
    bd-abc123.3 [P0] [bug] blocked - Login timeout
```

**Design Notes**
- Query dependencies where DependsOnID = parent ID AND type = parent-child
- Use tree characters from ui module (TreeChild, TreeIndent)
- Combine with --short for compact child listings
- JSON mode: include "children" array in parent object

**Acceptance**
- [ ] --children flag on bd show
- [ ] Parent details shown first
- [ ] Children listed with tree indentation
- [ ] Works with --short for compact display
- [ ] JSON mode includes children array
- [ ] Handles epics with many children efficiently

**Files:**
- `src/cli/show.rs`
- `src/core/workflow.rs` (helper to get children)
title: bd show --children to display child issues
